intro: Maddenia taschei, commonly known as Tasche's maddenia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers in clusters. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes other shrubs and herbs adapted to acidic soils. Maddenia taschei is often found in montane and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions.
